00032 namespace TNT
00033 {
00034 
00060 template <class T>
00061 class Fortran_Array3D 
00062 {
00063 
00064 
00065   private: 
00066 
00067 
00068                 /* For an (mxnxk) array, we internally keep an (kxnxm) "transposed"
00069                    C array and access A(i,j,k) as A[k-1][j-1][i-1].  The "-1" operation
00070                    is inlined in a tight loop and should be easily optimized.
00071                 */
00072                 Array3D<T> A_;
00073 
00074   public:
00075 
00076     typedef         T   value_type;
00077 
00078                Fortran_Array3D();
00079                Fortran_Array3D(int m, int n, int k);
00080                Fortran_Array3D(int m, int n, int k,  T *a);
00081                Fortran_Array3D(int m, int n, int k, const T &a);
00082     inline Fortran_Array3D(const Fortran_Array3D &A);
00083         inline Fortran_Array3D & operator=(const T &a);
00084         inline Fortran_Array3D & operator=(const Fortran_Array3D &A);
00085         inline Fortran_Array3D & ref(const Fortran_Array3D &A);
00086                Fortran_Array3D copy();
00087                    Fortran_Array3D & inject(const Fortran_Array3D & A);
00088         inline T& operator()(int i, int j, int k);
00089         inline const T& operator()(int i, int j, int k) const ;
00090         inline int dim1() const;
00091         inline int dim2() const;
00092         inline int dim3() const;
00093         inline int ref_count() const;
00094                ~Fortran_Array3D();
00095 
00096 
00097 };

00103 Fortran_Array3D<T>::Fortran_Array3D() : A_() {}

00113 Fortran_Array3D<T>::Fortran_Array3D(const Fortran_Array3D<T> &A) : A_(A.A_) {}

00130 Fortran_Array3D<T>::Fortran_Array3D(int m, int n, int k) : A_(k,n,m) {}

00144 template <class T>
00145 Fortran_Array3D<T>::Fortran_Array3D(int m, int n, int k, const T &val) : 
00146         A_(k, n, m, val) {}

00162 template <class T>
00163 Fortran_Array3D<T>::Fortran_Array3D(int m, int n, int k, T *a) : 
00164         A_(k, n, m, a) {}

00176 template <class T>
00177 inline T& Fortran_Array3D<T>::operator()(int i, int j, int k) 
00178 { 
00179 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00180         assert(k >= 1);
00181         assert(k <= A_.dim1());
00182         assert(j >= 1);
00183         assert(j <= A_.dim2());
00184         assert(i >= 1);
00185         assert(i <= A_.dim3());
00186 #endif
00187 
00188         return A_[k-1][j-1][i-1]; 
00189 
00190 }
00191 
00199 template <class T>
00200 inline const T& Fortran_Array3D<T>::operator()(int i, int j, int k)  const
00201 { 
00202 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00203         assert(k >= 1);
00204         assert(k <= A_.dim1());
00205         assert(j >= 1);
00206         assert(j <= A_.dim2());
00207         assert(i >= 1);
00208         assert(i <= A_.dim3());
00209 #endif
00210 
00211         return A_[k-1][j-1][i-1]; 
00212 
00213 }

00219 template <class T>
00220 Fortran_Array3D<T> & Fortran_Array3D<T>::operator=(const T &a)
00221 {
00222         A_ = a;
00223         return *this;
00224 }
00231 template <class T>
00232 Fortran_Array3D<T> Fortran_Array3D<T>::copy()
00233 {
00234 
00235         Fortran_Array3D B;
00236         
00237         B.A_= A_.copy();
00238         return B;
00239 }

00265 template <class T>
00266 Fortran_Array3D<T> & Fortran_Array3D<T>::inject(const Fortran_Array3D &A)
00267 {
00268         A_.inject(A.A_);
00269 
00270         return *this;
00271 }

00287 template <class T>
00288 Fortran_Array3D<T> & Fortran_Array3D<T>::ref(const Fortran_Array3D<T> &A)
00289 {
00290         A_.ref(A.A_);
00291         return *this;
00292 }

00297 template <class T>
00298 Fortran_Array3D<T> & Fortran_Array3D<T>::operator=(const Fortran_Array3D<T> &A)
00299 {
00300         return ref(A);
00301 }

00306 template <class T>
00307 inline int Fortran_Array3D<T>::dim1() const { return A_.dim3(); }
00308 
00312 template <class T>
00313 inline int Fortran_Array3D<T>::dim2() const { return A_.dim2(); }

00319 inline int Fortran_Array3D<T>::dim3() const { return A_.dim1(); }
